channel.title: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?
channel.description:
Long story short, I graduated with my bachelors in web development/security and sadly learned no real java scripting.
I taught myself over the last 2 years how to code with python, php, c, and ruby, just looking for a "fun" way on learning java and was curious if anyone had any input on this.

item.title: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

What do you mean by learning through rsc?

Do you plan on learning the language by studying the source or using it to apply your knowledge?
You won’t get far writing a hello world program using “player.sendMessage(“hello world”);”

Learning is also different from applying knowledge.

Read full topic
item.source: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?

item.title: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

This will be the fun way into learning java. It will feel more interactive and the sense of accomplishment will be better when your fixing bugs or visually seeing the progress as you tweak the RSC server, at the cost of learning java slower, missing out on important early concepts and possibly taking in bad design practices.

Read full topic
item.source: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?

item.title: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?
item.dc:creator: @imabeast imabeast
item.description:
@imabeast wrote:

Thanks for the advice everyone.

Read full topic
item.source: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?

item.title: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Don’t listen to these typical rs2ers. The answer is yes and no. Picking up a RSC server is a great start if that fuels your interest for programming. However, it can also be a limitation. You should always remind yourself that there is much more to programming/java than the RSC server.

When you’re learning the programming language, learn the programming language and use it to implement RSC features. Don’t use RSC features teach you how to program.

Read full topic
item.source: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?

item.title: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You could attempt to do exercises you’ve completed in those four languages you named in Java as you learn, might help you see how the relate, and how they’re different to help the transition.

Read full topic
item.source: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?

item.title: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Like casey said, no. You don’t want to mix learning the RS protocol in while you are trying to learn a language too. Learn Java first then learn the RS protocol.

PS Did you really expect to learn any Java while doing web dev?

Read full topic
item.source: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?

item.title: Will messing around on a RSC server help me learn java?

casey.:

no

judging by your previous post threatening to ddos people and bragging about vpns, I’ll just pretend you never posted on my thread.
